Message.Title: Apple will eventually drop Google search for Yahoo! Axis
Message.Msg: Yahoo! is already the default data source for the iPhone stocks apps and Weather. More importantly, they released a new mobile search engine a few months ago called Axis under the direction of Sashi Seth. Axis is really, really good. You can use it directly in a smart phone and tablet or as an add-on to any PC-based browser. The results are fantastic and especially interesting with a more visual component for mobile searches. Eric Jackson at Forbes
Glad I shorted Yahoo at $17, $18, $19.... $27 and $28 when the coldone said to buy. Glad you bought Yahoo at $25, $26, $27 and $28 when the coldone said to.

Yesterday I explained why MSFT won't get out of on-line services and won't sell Bing to Yahoo. Your pumping is getting annoying. In your Forbes article you say that Apple waited until its new mapping service was better than Goog's before dropping their product and you say Siri is the future of Apple search and a Goog killer, and that Apple didn't switch to Bing because it wasn't stable enough at the time, so why would Apple want Yahoo? Switching to Yahoo violates all of the rules you posted earlier in your article. Sounds to me like you were hitting the bottle while writing that article Buddy.
